name: arwes
readme_summary: Arwes is a web framework written in TypeScript for building user interfaces with a futuristic sci-fi aesthetic, including designs, animations, and sound effects. It draws inspiration from Cyberprep and productions like Star Citizen and Halo, aiming to inspire advanced science and technology in web development.
primary_use_case: Building futuristic sci-fi themed web applications.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled technician in a high-tech control room is assembling a holographic spaceship interface from glowing components. Data streams flow around them, forming buttons, displays, and animated elements characteristic of a futuristic UI. The technician wears a sleek headset and uses specialized tools to manipulate the holographic projections. Subtle code snippets and UI elements float in the background, subtly connecting the scene to software development. The control room is bathed in a cool blue light with accents of vibrant orange. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and visual appeal.

name: dockpeek
description: Easily access your Docker container web interfaces and keep them up to date â€” across all your hosts.
readme_summary: Dockpeek is a lightweight, self-hosted Docker dashboard that provides quick access to your containers' web interfaces. It simplifies container management by offering features like one-click access, automatic port mapping, live logs, Traefik integration, multi-host management, and image update checks.
primary_use_case: Easy access and management of Docker container web interfaces across multiple hosts.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a lighthouse keeper standing atop a tower, overseeing a sea of shipping containers. Each container has a small light representing its web interface. The keeper uses a specialized control panel to quickly access and monitor these containers, represented by beams of light connecting the tower to each container. Some containers have update icons floating above them, indicating available upgrades. The scene is set at dusk with a calm sea and a clear sky. Small UI elements on the control panel show container details and logs. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: vulnhuntr
description: Zero shot vulnerability discovery using LLMs
readme_summary: Vulnhuntr is a tool that uses LLMs and static code analysis to automatically discover remotely exploitable vulnerabilities in software. It analyzes code call chains from user input to server output, aiming to detect complex, multi-step security vulnerabilities that traditional static analysis tools may miss.
key_features: Identification of LFI, AFO, RCE, XSS, SQLI, SSRF, and IDOR vulnerabilities
primary_use_case: Automated vulnerability detection in GitHub repositories.
cover_image_prompt: A cyber security expert, represented as a digital detective with a magnifying glass enhanced with glowing code, is examining a complex network of interconnected servers and code repositories. The detective is uncovering hidden vulnerabilities, depicted as glowing red cracks within the network. Successfully scanned and secured components emit a calming green aura. Small UI elements display vulnerability scan results and security metrics. The scene is set in a futuristic, data-rich environment with a blue and purple color scheme and dramatic lighting. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.
